intro: Anemone hakodatensis, commonly known as the Hakodate anemone, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant features palmate leaves with a hairy texture and has a short stem that supports its cup-shaped petals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
